thread.title: Younis Khan surpasses Javed Miandad as Pakistan’s highest run-getter in Test cricket
thread.title_full: Younis Khan surpasses Javed Miandad as Pakistan’s highest run-getter in Test cricket

author: Aayush Puthran | India.com Sports Desk
title: Younis Khan surpasses Javed Miandad as Pakistan’s highest run-getter in Test cricket
text: Younis Khan surpasses Javed Miandad as Pakistan’s highest run-getter in Test cricket By India.com Sports Desk on October 13, 2015 at 6:18 PM Comments Pakistan batsman Younis Khan went past Javed Miandad as the highest run-getter for Pakistan in Tests. Before the start of the first Test match between Pakistan and England at the Dubai International Stadium in the United Arab Emirates, Younis needed 19 runs to go past Miandad. The batsman went past the landmark in the 62 nd over of Day One. (Also Catch: Pakistan vs England 1st Test Live Scorecard and Ball by Ball Commentary here ) Miandad held the record for over two and a half decade. He finished his 124-match career with 8832 runs. Younis reached the figure in just 102 matches. Former Pakistan captain Inzamam-ul-Haq had come close to overtaking Miandad’s record, but retired three runs short of his run-mark. Younis Khan already has the record of most centuries by a Pakistani batsman (30). Batsman
